intro: Poranthera arbuscula, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Poranthera arbuscula is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its analgesic and anti-inflammatory effects.
